title: Kenya: Vihiga Nurses Threaten to Go on Strike
text:
Cameroon: Japoma Road - Over 50 Percent Work Executed 
In the notice, Panyako said other than delays in payment of salaries, Knun Vihiga branch had raised several issues that remained unresolved by the county government. 
"Even after consultation with county government, there is still failure to ensure timely payment of salaries, promotion and re-designation of qualified and deserving officers," reads the notice. 
The notice further demands implementation of the new house allowance as per the Salaries and Remuneration Commission December 2014 circular. 
Vihiga nurses have accused the county administration of failing to issue some of them with secondment letters from the national government to confirm their deployment. 
He said the health centers in the county had been understaffed. He said their request to have more staff brought on board had failed. 
The union also complained of the remittances of statutory deductions and alleged that union officials in the county were being intimidated by senior health officials. 
The branch secretary Caleb Maloba is urged to mobilise his members to prepare for the strike. 
Panyako said the union will remain open to dialogue in the interim period up to September 6. Kenya
